Module_Description: The motor_pair module is used to run motors in a synchronized fashion. This mode is optimal for creating drivebases where you'd want a pair of motors to start and stop at the same time.
SubModule_Description: The motor_pair module is used to run motors in a synchronized fashion. This mode is optimal for creating drivebases where you'd want a pair of motors to start and stop at the same time.

Function.Function_Signature: move_tank(pair: int, left_velocity: int, right_velocity: int, *, acceleration: int = 1000) -> None
Function.Function_Description: Perform a tank move on a Motor Pair at a constant speed until a new command is given.

Function_Arguments.Argument_Description: The pair slot of the Motor Pair.
The velocity (deg/sec) of the left motor.
The velocity (deg/sec) of the right motor.

Function_Snippet.Python_Code:
from hub import port
import runloop
import motor_pair

async def main():
    # Pair motors on port A and B 
    motor_pair.pair(motor_pair.PAIR_1, port.A, port.B)

    # Move straight at default velocity 
    motor_pair.move_tank(motor_pair.PAIR_1, 1000, 1000)

    await runloop.sleep_ms(2000)

    # Turn right 
    motor_pair.move_tank(motor_pair.PAIR_1, 0, 1000)

    await runloop.sleep_ms(2000)

    # Perform tank turn 
    motor_pair.move_tank(motor_pair.PAIR_1, 1000, -1000)

runloop.run(main())
